USER_NOT_ON_LEADERBOARD: You are not on the leaderboard!
LEADERBOARD_POSITION: You are #{{POSITION}} on the leaderboard, with {{COUNT}} count(s) total.
ROLEREWARD_NOT_FOUND: A role reward does not exist with that ID.
PINTRIGGER_NOT_FOUND: A pin trigger does not exist with that ID.

PINGED: Server latency is {{LATENCY.SERVER}} and API latency is {{LATENCY.API}}.

REGEX_LIST: List of regex filters set up:

COUNT_X_GIVES_Y: Count number {{COUNT}} will give the role {{ROLE}} {{PERMANENT}}
SAVING_ROLEREWARD_EDITS: Saving role reward edits to database...
SAVING_PINTRIGGER_EDITS: Saving pin trigger edits to database...

SAVED_ROLEREWARD_EDITS: Saved role reward edits to database.
SAVED_PINTRIGGER: Saved pin trigger to database. ID `{{ID}}`

SAVED_LIVEBOARD_LOADING: Saved liveboard to database. This message will be used as the liveboard. Updating in (less than) 60 seconds.

MODULES.allow-spam: Allow people to talk multiple times in a row, essentially spamming the channel.
MODULES.talking: Allow people to send a message after the number.
MODULES.recover: If the bot goes offline, make it remove all unprocessed messages in the counting channel when it's back up.
MODULES.reposting: Repost the message being sent in an embed, preventing the users from editing or self-deleting their message.
MODULES.webhook: Make all messages get reposted using a webhook, preventing users from editing or self-deleting their message.

COMMAND_ADDPIN.description: Add a pin trigger so that milestones gets pinned in the chat.

usage.<mode>: If you use "only", it will only be that count you specify. If you use "each", it will be each count in the multiplication table, example; 7 = 7, 14, 21, 28, 35 etc. If you use "each", it will be the user's count and not the server count.
usage.<count>: This is the count you want the role to be triggered on.
usage.<action>: If you use "keep", the message will be kept. If you use "repost", Countr will repost the count. This does not get triggered when using modules such as reposting and webhook.

examples.each 1000 repost: This will repost each 1000th count and pin it.
examples.only 420 keep: This will only pin the 420th count, and the message is still owned by the user.

COMMAND_ADDREGEX.description: Add a regex filter for the chat of the channel. (With use of the talking module)

usage.<regex...>: The regex. Get info on how to make a regex filter here: <https://flaviocopes.com/javascript-regular-expressions/#regular-expressions-choices>

examples.duck|poop|trump: This regex will delete the message if it contains "duck", "poop" and/or "trump".
examples.[A-Z]: This regex will delete the message if it contains any capital letters.
examples.[A-Ca-cX-Zx-z]: This regex will delete the message if it contains A, B, C, X, Y and/or Z, regardless if it's a capital letter or not.

COMMAND_ADDROLE.description: Add a role that get rewarded users on whatever count you want.

usage.<role>: This is the role you want to be rewarded. This can either be the name, mention or ID of the role. If you have spaces in your role name, replace those with underscores.
usage.<mode>: If you use "only", it will only be that count you specify. If you use "each", it will be each count in the multiplication table, example; 7 = 7, 14, 21, 28, 35 etc. If you use "each", it will be the user's count and not the server count.
usage.<count>: This is the count you want the role to be triggered on.
usage.<duration>: If you use "temporary", the role will be removed from everyone already having it, and added to the new person. If you use "permanent", you keep the role unless someone removes it.

examples.Count_Champ each 1000 temporary: This will give the user who counts 1000, 2000, 3000 etc. the role named Count Champ, and the last user who had the role lose it.
examples.469523835595653120 only 420 permanent: This will give every user who reach count 420 the role with the ID 469523835595653120, and will stay on the user forever (until a user removes it).

COMMAND_AUTOSETUP.description: Quickly setup a counting channel with this command. Requires Manage Channels.

COMMAND_EDITPIN.description: Quickly setup a counting channel with this command. Requires Manage Channels.

usage.<ID>: This is the ID of the pin trigger. This can be found if you type `{{PREFIX}}pins`.
usage.<property>: This will be what you want to edit. Valid properties: `mode`, `count`, `action`.
usage.<value>: Read `{{PREFIX}}help addpin` to see the different values for each property.

examples.wnoK3d mode each: This will change the pin trigger ID `wnoK3d`'s mode to `each`.
examples.89hJzm count 1337: This will change the pin trigger ID `89hJzm`'s count to 1337.

usage.<ID>: This is the ID of the role reward. This can be found if you type `{{PREFIX}}roles`.
usage.<property>: This will be what you want to edit. Valid properties: `role`, `mode`, `count`, `duration`.
usage.<value>: Read `{{PREFIX}}help addrole` to see the different values for each property.

examples.MnRIf4 mode each: This will change the Role Reward ID `MnRIf4`'s mode to `each`.
examples.jPFj78 count 1337: This will change the Role Reward ID `jPFj78`'s count to 1337.

COMMAND_HELP.description: Get a link to the documentation or get help on a command.

examples.help: Get help for the command help. (what a stupid example when you're already here)

COMMAND_LANGUAGE.description: Set the language for this guild.

usage.[language]: Specify what language you want to use. Leave empty to get a list.

usage.[channel]: Specify what channel you want to become the counting channel. This can either be the name, mention or ID of the channel. If it's empty, it will be the channel the command was sent in.

COMMAND_LISTREGEX.description: Get a list of regex filters set up.

usage.[channel]: Specify what channel you want the liveboard message to go in. Leave empty to choose current channel.

examples.#counting_board: Make a liveboard in the channel #counting_board.

COMMAND_NOTIFS.description: Get a list of your notifications in the server.

COMMAND_NOTIFYME.description: Get a notification whenever the server reach whatever count you want.

usage.[each]: If you use "each" here, it will be each count in the multiplication table, example; 9 = 9, 18, 27, 36, 45 etc.
usage.<count>: This is the count you want to get notified of.

examples.each 1000: Whenever the server reach 1000, 2000, 3000 etc. you will be notified in DMs.
examples.420: Whenever the server reach the count 420, you will be notified in DMs.

COMMAND_PING.description: Check server latency and API latency.

COMMAND_PREFIX.description: Set a new prefix for the bot.

usage.<prefix...>: The new prefix. If you want a space after the prefix, end the prefix with {{SPACE}}.

examples.c?: Set the prefix to `c?`, the help command would be `c?help`.
examples.Hey Countr,{{SPACE}}: Set the prefix to `Hey Countr, `, the help command would be `Hey Countr, help`

usage.<ID>: This is the ID of the pin trigger. This can be found if you type `{{PREFIX}}roles`.

usage.<regex...>: The regex you want to remove.

usage.<ID>: This is the notification ID. All your notification IDs can be found in `{{PREFIX}}notifs`.
This is the ID of the role reward. This can be found if you type `{{PREFIX}}roles`.

examples.4s2h2Q: Remove the Role Reward with ID `4s2h2Q`

COMMAND_ROLES.description: Get a list of role rewards in the server.

COMMAND_SETSCORE.description: Set the score of a user.

usage.<user>: Specify the user you want to modify.
usage.<count>: Specify the count you want to set as score.

examples.@Promise#0001 1000: This will set Promise's score to 1000.
examples.110090225929191424 9999999: This will set the user with ID `110090225929191424`'s score to 9999999

usage.<role>: Specify the role you want to set as the timeout role.
usage.<time>: Specify the time window of when the fails "reset" themselves, in seconds.
usage.<fails>: Specify the amount of fails within the time window the user needs to get the role.
usage.[duration]: Specify how long the user will have it, in seconds. If not specified, the user will have it until someone removes it from them.

examples.Timed_out 10 5: This will give the user the role called "Timed out" if they fail 5 times within 10 seconds. The role stays on permanent.
examples.531877473437220866 30 3 120: This will give the user the role with ID "531877473437220866" if they fail 3 times within 30 seconds. The role stays on for 120 seconds/2 minutes.

COMMAND_TOGGLE.description: Toggle a module or get a list of modules.

usage.[module]: Specify what module you want to toggle. Leave emoty for a list of them.

COMMAND_TOP.description: Get the leaderboard of the server.

usage.<topic...>: Set the topic to whatever you want. Use `{{COUNT}}` as a placeholder for the count. If you put "reset", it will reset back to default. If you put "disable", the topic will never change.

examples.Count to infinity! Next count is {{COUNT: An example of using a placeholder.
